oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pasteurization Effects on Mycobacterium paratuberculosis, Escherichia coli 0157:H7, Salmonella spp, Listeria monocytogenes, and Staphylococcus aureus
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Green, Lorissa
Godden, Sandra
Feirtag, Joellen
Fetrow, John
Wells, Scott
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: pasteurization units
Mycobacterium paratuberculosis
bulk-tank milk
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This study evaluated the efficacy of on-farm commercial pasteurization units and their effectiveness in destroying Mycobacterium paratuberculosis, Escherichia coli 0157:H7, Salmonella spp, Listeria monocytogenes, and Staphylococcus aureus in saleable bulk-tank milk inoculated with both a low inoculum level (between -102 and 103 CFU/ml) and a higher inoculum (between -105 and 106 CFU/ml).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2002; 190
